original: Åkesson, Nils Hjalmar, bankdirektör, Falköping, f. 26/6/90 i Nevitshög, Malmöh. 1., av Åke Nilsson o. Kerstin Jönsson. G. 18 m. Kerstin Andersson, d. 33. Barn: Åke f. 20, jur. kand. — Stud:ex. i Lund 12. Anst. v. Skand. Kredit A-B 12-17, v. A-B Ind :banken 17, kamrer v. Trelleb:-kont. s. å., förste kassör v. Nord. Han-d :bankens Malmökont. 18, kassör v. Gbgs Hand :banks Falköp :kon’t. 25, kamrer 29, dir. o. led. av styr. 38. Rådman sed. 43. Lär. i bokför, v. Falköp. yrkessk. 28-35, led. av tax:nd 28-32, kronoomb. 33-35, stadsrev. 28-39. Res. t. Nordkap 34, Tyskl., Belg., Holl., Kanarieöarna 38, Tyskl., Ung. 39, Ital. o. Schw^eiz 48. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd Fellow, Sällsk. N. N. i Falköping.
translated: Åkesson, Nils Hjalmar, bank director, Falköping, born on June 26, 1890 in Nevitshög, Malmöhus County, the son of Åke Nilsson and Kerstin Jönsson. Married on August 18, 19xx to Kerstin Andersson, deceased in 1933. Children: Åke, born in 1920, law graduate. Completed high school in Lund in 1912. Employed by Skandinaviska Kreditaktiebolaget from 1912 to 1917, then at AB Industribanken from 1917. Became cashier at Trelleborg branch the same year, and first cashier at Nordiska Handelsbanken's Malmö branch in 1918. Became the cashier at Göteborgs Handelsbank's Falköping branch in 1925, promoted to cashier in 1929, and became the director and board member in 1938. Appointed magistrate in 1943. Taught bookkeeping at Falköping Vocational School from 1928 to 1935. Served as a member of the taxation committee from 1928 to 1932, county tax commissioner from 1933 to 1935, and city auditor from 1928 to 1939. Traveled to Nordkap in 1934, Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands, and the Canary Islands in 1938, Germany and Hungary in 1939, Italy and Switzerland in 1948. Member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellow, and Society N. N. in Falköping.
